name: (2Z)-2-(1,3-Benzodioxol-5-ylmethylene)-6,7-dihydro-5H-[1,3]thiazolo[3,2-a]pyrimidin-3(2H)-one
Reason: 1,3-Benzodioxole has a melting point around 100 degrees Celsius. The methylene bridge introduces additional rigidity, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The dioxane-like bridging moiety raises the melting point due to increased molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The thiazole ring introduces additional rigidity, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The pyrimidine ring introduces additional rigidity, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The methyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around -5 degrees Celsius.
